questions.question: …………………….. you mind moving a bit?
questions.description: Would is used in polite requests.

questions.question: …………………… you lend me your vacuum cleaner?
You ……………………….. not repeat this.
questions.description: Shall can express an order when used with second and third person pronouns.

questions.question: You ……………………….. pay for this.
questions.description: When used with second and third person pronouns, shall can indicate a threat.

questions.question: All students ………………………… submit their assignments by Friday.
You …………………………… leave early if you are not feeling well.
questions.description: Either can or may is possible here.

questions.question: You ………………………….. not have done this to me.
questions.description: The expression should not have is used to criticize people for doing things.

questions.question: The workers asked if they ………………………… leave early.
I ………………………… sing better when I was younger.
questions.description: We use could to indicate past ability.

questions.question: If I knew his name, I ………………………. tell you.
questions.description: In the second conditional we use a simple past in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: He hung up before I ............................. say a word.
